channel.title: Posts on Kirsten Gotting
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Kirsten Gotting

item.title: Moving to blogdown
item.description: Earlier this week I was dissapointed with how little I had posted to my blog. One post from over a year ago did not fit with my personal expectations, and a ongoing goal of mine has been to write more. I originally built my website using Jekyll, since it was easy to port to github and supports markdown formatted documents. Whenever I was actively working on the website it would be easy for me to float around in that ecosystem, but given my sporatic motivation, returning to that format has become a barrier.

item.title: Making an Rmarkdown Website with Rstudio
item.description: Summary Points: Make all code chunks have different names Clean the cache before rebuilding the website Make the _site.yml simple, adding details to individual pages Use the ‘.gitignore’ file and the ‘exclude:[]’ option in the _site.yml Include a ‘footer.html’, ‘header.html’, and ‘styles.css’ in the _site.yml file In picking a tool for creating a website to display a some biological data analysis for the ctenophore project, I looked for tools that would seemlesly fit into my current data analysis framework (primarily R coding in Rmarkdown using Rstudio as my text editor).
